alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 25 at 2:39AM MDT until March 25 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...AREAS OF HEAVY SNOW ON THE NORTHEAST PLAINS... .An area of snow will move across northeastern Colorado today, with the snow lingering into tonight in the northeast corner. The heaviest snow this morning will move from Weld county across Morgan county. For this afternoon and evening, it will shift to Sterling and Akron and areas further east and northeast. The snow will be heavy at times and will produce snow covered roads and limited visibilities. In areas west of Sterling and Akron, conditions should improve this afternoon. Further east there may be some help with highways from warm temperatures this afternoon, but icy and snow covered roads will be likely this evening. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Snow accumulations 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Briggsdale, Greeley, and Fort Morgan. * WHEN...The heaviest snow will be this morning, with snow ending this afternoon. Winds will increase by midday causing minor drifting of the snow. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and areas of poor visibility in the heavier showers.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
